Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that looks healthy, showing it has enough water.
The student can draw a plant that looks unhealthy, showing it does not have enough water.
The student can illustrate the difference in appearance between plants with water and plants without water.
The student can include elements in the drawing that show the need for light, such as a sun or lamp, to indicate plants need light to grow.
The student can label the parts of the plant, such as roots, stem, and leaves, especially in relation to water absorption.
The student can demonstrate an understanding that plants need water by showing roots absorbing water from soil.
